id: 2.6 Is personal information in scope for this initiative? (Single selection allowed) *
nextPrompt:
Question 2.6: Does the initiative involve Personal Information (PI)? Please list all types of personal information in scope, such as name, email, SIN, health history, etc.

Options:
1. Yes
2. No

This question is part of Cluster 2.

Explanation: We need to know if PI is in scope so we can determine if the Privacy & Consent sections (Clusters 4 & 5) are required.

id: 2.7 Is personal health information (PHI) in scope for this initiative? (Single selection allowed) *
nextPrompt:
Question 2.7: Does the initiative involve Personal Health Information (PHI)? PHI is a subset of personal information that relates to an individual's physical or mental health, including information about health services provided to them.

Options:
1. Yes
2. No

This question is part of Cluster 2.

Explanation: PHI is sensitive data subject to stricter rules and specific sections in the DEP (Section 5 and potentially Section 12).

id: 13.1 Identify any third parties involved in this initiative (Multiple selections allowed) (Justification allowed) (Allows other) *
nextPrompt:
Question 13.1: Please identify any third parties involved in this initiative. This includes vendors, partners, contractors, or any external organizations that will have access to TELUS data or systems.

Options:
1. No third parties
2. Yes, one third party
3. Yes, multiple third parties

This question is part of Cluster 13.

Explanation: Third-party involvement triggers the assessment of vendor risk, opening up the entire Section 13.

id: 9.1 How is credit card data (including PAN, CVV, expiry date, etc.) processed in your initiative? (Single selection allowed) (Justification allowed) (Allows other) *
nextPrompt:
Question 9.1: How is credit card data (including PAN, CVV, expiry date, etc.) processed in your initiative? Please select the most appropriate option.

Options:
1. TELUS internal payment system (Avalon/EPS)
2. Third-party service provider
3. Not applicable / No credit card data involved

This question is part of Cluster 9.

Explanation: Handling credit card data necessitates compliance with PCI standards, making Section 9 relevant.

id: 7.1 Is your initiative building or leveraging AI agents? (Single selection allowed) *
nextPrompt:
Question 7.1: Is your initiative building or leveraging any AI agents (i.e. Agentic AI) in this implementation? AI agents are systems that can make autonomous decisions or take actions on behalf of users.

Options:
1. Yes
2. No

This question is part of Cluster 7.

Explanation: AI/ML usage activates the dedicated Section 7 on AI risks and considerations.

id: 7.3 Does this initiative use Generative AI? (Single selection allowed) *
nextPrompt:
Question 7.3: Does this initiative use Generative AI? Generative AI refers to artificial intelligence systems that can generate new content, such as text, images, audio, or video, in response to prompts or based on patterns learned from training data.

Options:
1. Yes
2. No

This question is part of Cluster 7.

Explanation: Generative AI has specific sub-questions within the AI section (Q7.15â€“7.22) and unique risks to address.

Question 11.1: Which special regulatory regimes apply to this initiative? Please select all that apply to your project's data processing activities and jurisdictions.

Options:
1. Quebec's Law 25
2. GDPR (EU)
3. HIPAA (US health)
4. None of these

This question is part of Cluster 11.

Explanation: Applicable regional laws (Quebec, GDPR, HIPAA) determine the need for specific compliance sections (10, 11, 12).

id: 4.5 Does your initiative collect or infer personal information of minors (under the age of majority)? (Single selection allowed) *
nextPrompt:
Question 4.5: Does your initiative collect or infer personal information of minors (under the age of majority)? This includes any data about individuals who are under 18 or 19 years old, depending on the jurisdiction.

Options:
1. Yes
2. No

This question is part of Cluster 4.

Explanation: Involvement of minors triggers specific consent and privacy requirements (Q4.5, Q5.19, Q5.20).
